ref: 4742 cāturmāsyá n. pl. ʻ name of three sacrifices at the beginning of the 4 -- month period ʼ TS., n. ʻ beginning of a season of 4 -- months ʼ MBh. [caturmāsa -- ]
Pa. cātumāsin -- ʻ consisting of 4 months ʼ;

lang: Aśokan, i.e. the language of the Inscriptions of Aśoka
ref: Aś. cātuṁmāsī -- f. ʻ the full moon of each season ʼ, anucātuṁmāsaṁ ʻ at the beginning of every season ʼ;
Pk. cāummāsa -- m.n. ʻ the 4 months of the Rains ʼ, ˚sia -- ʻ lasting 4 months ʼ, n. ʻ a festival at the end of the Rains ʼ;
P. caumāsā, cum˚ m. ʻ the Rains ʼ prob. rather ←
